verses.text: By the waters of Meribah they angered the LORD, and trouble came to Moses because of them;

rsbNotes.title: Ps 106
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 106 While Ps. 105 is mainly concerned with God’s redemptive acts, this psalm focuses on human sin.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 106:32
rsbNotes.text: 106:32 waters of Meribah. See Num. 20:1–13.

verses.text: for they rebelled against the Spirit of God, and rash words came from Moses' lips.
They did not destroy the peoples as the LORD had commanded them,
but they mingled with the nations and adopted their customs.
They worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 106:33
rsbNotes.text: 106:33 they made his spirit bitter. By not trusting God to provide for their survival in the wilderness.

verses.text: They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was desecrated by their blood.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 106:37
rsbNotes.text: 106:37 to the demons. The spiritual reality behind the lifeless idols is demonic, a world of hostility to the one God.

verses.text: They defiled themselves by what they did; by their deeds they prostituted themselves.
Therefore the LORD was angry with his people and abhorred his inheritance.
He handed them over to the nations, and their foes ruled over them.
Their enemies oppressed them and subjected them to their power.
Many times he delivered them, but they were bent on rebellion and they wasted away in their sin.
But he took note of their distress when he heard their cry;

rsbNotes.title: Ps 106:39
rsbNotes.text: 106:39 they . . . played the whore. Joining themselves to a false god is spiritual adultery.

verses.text: for their sake he remembered his covenant and out of his great love he relented.
He caused them to be pitied by all who held them captive.
Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praise.
Praise be to the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Let all the people say, "Amen!" Praise the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 106:45
rsbNotes.text: 106:45 he remembered his covenant. God’s promises express the commitment that causes Him to continue with His people even though they turned their backs on Him. On remembrance, see Ps. 105:5.
